dc:description:
In association with a late-onset, axonal, sensorimotor polyneuropathy, MED25 was first described in a Costa Rican family with an extended multi-generational, autosomal recessive pedigree (Leal et al., 2001; PMID: 11112660; Berghoff et al., 2004; PMID: 15099588; Leal et al., 2009; PMID: 19290556). Since its first description, however, no further associated CMT families have been published. Contrarily, the only reported variant has been found in a homozygous state in 4 unaffected individuals (GnomAD). Re-assessing the first and only reported family by WES, Leal et al. identified a homozygous stop mutation in PNKP, a gene that is located in the same linkage region (Leal et al., 2018; PMID: 11112660). The authors identified 5 further families carrying biallelic loss-of-function mutations in PNKP as well, pointing towards the pathogenicity of this gene over MED25. With no further strong experimental evidence supporting the gene-disease relationship between MED25 and CMT2B, we thereby classify the gene as “DISPUTED”. The likewise associated, autosomal recessive Basel-Vanagaite-Smirin-Yosef syndrome has a congenital age at onset and does not include neuropathy in its phenotypic spectrum. 

Only one CMT2B family described with one mutation, WES identified another gene in the same family.
